top_categories.workout_context: 300 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 300 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Rule of Three's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
300 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
At Rule of Three, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Rule of Three's Kansas Flint Hills gravel (95%), Pavement (5%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 300 miles.
50ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
15,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 15,000ft of climbing on Kansas Flint Hills—same roads as Unbound, ultra does to your power file on race day.
15,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rule of Three. Train it until it feels boring.
Low-cadence force work for 15,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.heat: September in Emporia, Kansas (same roads as Unbound Gravel) can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Rule of Three. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 300 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 300 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Rule of Three requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on kansas flint hills—same roads as unbound, ultra distance to build confidence. Expect: kansas flint hills gravel (95%), pavement (5%), same roads as unbound.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Endurance, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 300 miles of kansas flint hills—same roads as unbound, ultra distance in Emporia, Kansas (same roads as Unbound Gravel).
